definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to blame
to bury
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Do you plod through the day at the office?
sentences.chinese: 你是否在辦公室裏埋頭苦幹了一整天呢？

sentences.english: I like your down-to-earth and hardworking spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我就喜歡你們這股紮紮實實埋頭苦幹的勁兒。

sentences.english: Toiling away at a job you hate may eat away at your happiness over time.
sentences.chinese: 埋頭苦幹一項你痛恨的工作可能會逐漸侵蝕你的快樂。

sentences.english: Firm and steadly, guietly works hard, makes the drip contribution for the society.
sentences.chinese: 堅毅踏實，埋頭苦幹，爲社會作出點滴貢獻。

sentences.english: Your quiet hard work will command respect.
sentences.chinese: 你那埋頭苦幹的精神令人尊敬。

sentences.english: In an agricultural and industrial era, hard work was crucial.
sentences.chinese: 在農業和工業時代，埋頭苦幹是最重要的素質。

sentences.english: We have to put our nose to the grindstone if we want to finish painting the house today.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們今天想把房子漆完就得埋頭苦幹。

sentences.english: He slogged away at that report for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他埋頭苦幹了幾個星期寫那份報告。

sentences.english: Does the thought of “buckling down” repel you?
sentences.chinese: 那種“埋頭苦幹”的想法讓你厭煩嗎？

sentences.english: I slaved away on the desk for two hours.
He industriously engages in unostentatious hard work.
Richy: What we need is someone who keeps his nose to the grindstone.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要任勞任怨，埋頭苦幹的人。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to fight alone (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to use up/to exhaust
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to work hard
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
